x_symbol.description: This object is a nestable, dual-pane splitter. It can be horizontal or vertical. Each xSplitter has two panes. Pane1 is the left (or top) pane, and pane2 is the right (or bottom) pane. An xSplitter can be nested inside any pane of any other xSplitter. xSplitter makes no assumptions about classnames or id strings - the only requirement is that the xSplitter DIV contain 3 child DIVs in this order: pane1, pane2, and dragBar.
x_symbol.syntax: new xSplitter(sSplId, uSplX, uSplY, uSplW, uSplH, bHorizontal, uBarW, uBarPos, uBarLimit1, uBarLimit2, bBarEnabled, uSplBorderW[, oSplChild1[, oSplChild2]])

par.name: uSplX
par.note: splitter element's x position relative to its container

par.name: uSplY
par.note: splitter element's y position relative to its container

par.name: uSplW
par.note: splitter element's initial width (use 0 if splitter is nested)

par.name: uSplH
par.note: splitter element's initial height (use 0 if splitter is nested)

par.name: uBarPos
par.note: dragbar initial position measured from left (or top) edge of splitter

par.name: uBarLimit1
par.note: dragbar limit for left (or top) pane

par.name: uBarLimit2
par.note: dragbar limit for right (or bottom) pane

par.name: bBarEnabled
par.note: true = pane resizing enabled, false = pane resizing disabled

par.name: uSplBorderW
par.note: splitter element's border size set via css

par.name: oSplChild1
par.note: optional xSplitter object nested in left (or top) pane

par.name: oSplChild2
par.note: optional xSplitter object nested in right (or bottom) pane

meth.name: setDragEnd(deCallbackFn)
meth.note: deCallbackFn will be called at the end of a bar-drag. It will be passed two arguments: 'splEle' and 'barPos'.

comment.author: mf
comment.note: The overall width and height of the splitter is set with the uSplW and uSplH arguments to the constructor. But if the splitter is to be nested then you should pass 0 for width and height. The way to control the sizes of the individual panes is to set the drag-bar's initial position with the uBarPos argument. uBarPos is measured from the left (or top) edge of the splitter. Basically, for horizontal splitters uBarPos defines the width of pane1 (the left pane). For vertical splitters uBarPos defines the height of pane1 (the top pane). You can restrict the drag-bar's movement with uBarLimit. The bar can never be dragged so that either pane is less than uBarLimit. uBarPos - dragbar initial position measured from left (or top) edge of splitter. uBarLimit - dragbar limit, uBarLimit <= BarPosition <= (uSplW - uBarLimit), or uSplH if vertical
